summary: Record numbers of people have become homeless in recent years, and the federal government spends billions of dollars per year on shelter and prevention programs. Each year, HUD uses data from shelters across the country to estimate how many people used homelessness services. These published estimates are critical for understanding how the programs are working and where additional resources are needed. However, we found that...
title: Homelessness: Agency Actions Could Improve Data on Shelter Program Use
